verses.verse: Moreover Elihu <S%H453><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%>,
Hear <S%H8085><s%> my words <S%H4405><s%>, ye wise <S%H2450><s%> men <S%H238><s%>; And give ear unto me <S%H3045><s%>, ye that have knowledge.
For the ear <S%H241><s%> trieth <S%H974><s%> words <S%H4405><s%>, As the palate <S%H2441><s%> tasteth <S%H2938><s%> food <S%H398><s%>.
Let us choose <S%H977><s%> for us that which is right <S%H4941><s%>: Let us know <S%H3045><s%> among ourselves what is good <S%H2896><s%>.
For Job <S%H347><s%> hath said <S%H559><s%>, I am righteous <S%H6663><s%>, And God <S%H410><s%> hath taken away <S%H5493><s%> my right <S%H4941><s%>:
Notwithstanding my right <S%H4941><s%> I am accounted a liar <S%H3576><s%>; My wound <S%H2671><s%> is incurable <S%H605><s%>, though I am without transgression <S%H6588><s%>.
What man <S%H1397><s%> is like Job <S%H347><s%>, Who drinketh up <S%H8354><s%> scoffing <S%H3933><s%> like water <S%H4325><s%>,
Who goeth <S%H732><s%> in company <S%H2274><s%> with the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%>, And walketh <S%H3212><s%> with wicked <S%H7562><s%> men <S%H582><s%>?
For he hath said <S%H559><s%>, It profiteth <S%H5532><s%> a man <S%H1397><s%> nothing That he should delight <S%H7521><s%> himself with God <S%H430><s%>.

Therefore hearken <S%H8085><s%> unto me <S%H582><s%>, ye men of understanding <S%H3824><s%>: Far be it <S%H2486><s%> from God <S%H410><s%>, that he should do wickedness <S%H7562><s%>, And from the Almighty <S%H7706><s%>, that he should commit iniquity <S%H5766><s%>.
For the work <S%H6467><s%> of a man <S%H120><s%> will he render <S%H7999><s%> unto him <S%H376><s%>, And cause every man to find <S%H4672><s%> according to his ways <S%H734><s%>.
Yea <S%H551><s%>, of a surety, God <S%H410><s%> will not do wickedly <S%H7561><s%>, Neither will the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> pervert <S%H5791><s%> justice <S%H4941><s%>.
Who gave him a charge <S%H6485><s%> over the earth <S%H776><s%>? Or who hath disposed <S%H7760><s%> the whole world <S%H8398><s%>?
If he set <S%H7760><s%> his heart <S%H3820><s%> upon himself <S%H622><s%>, If he gather unto himself his spirit <S%H7307><s%> and his breath <S%H5397><s%>;
All flesh <S%H1320><s%> shall perish <S%H1478><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>, And man <S%H120><s%> shall turn again <S%H7725><s%> unto dust <S%H6083><s%>.
If now thou hast understanding <S%H998><s%>, hear <S%H8085><s%> this <S%H238><s%>: Hearken to the voice <S%H6963><s%> of my words <S%H4405><s%>.
Shall even one that hateth <S%H8130><s%> justice <S%H4941><s%> govern <S%H2280><s%>? And wilt thou condemn <S%H7561><s%> him that is righteous <S%H6662><s%> and mighty <S%H3524><s%>?â€”
Him that saith <S%H559><s%> to a king <S%H4428><s%>, Thou art vile <S%H7563><s%>, Or to nobles <S%H5081><s%>, Ye are wicked <S%H1100><s%>;

That respecteth <S%H5375><s%> not the persons <S%H6440><s%> of princes <S%H8269><s%>, Nor regardeth <S%H5234><s%> the rich <S%H7771><s%> more than <S%H6440><s%> the poor <S%H1800><s%>; For they all are the work <S%H4639><s%> of his hands <S%H3027><s%>.

In a moment <S%H7281><s%> they die <S%H4191><s%>, even at midnight <S%H2676><s%>; The people <S%H5971><s%> are shaken <S%H1607><s%> and pass away <S%H5674><s%>, And the mighty <S%H47><s%> are taken away <S%H5674><s%> without hand <S%H3027><s%>.
For his eyes <S%H5869><s%> are upon the ways <S%H1870><s%> of a man <S%H376><s%>, And he seeth <S%H7200><s%> all his goings <S%H6806><s%>.
There is no darkness <S%H2822><s%>, nor thick gloom <S%H6757><s%>, Where the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%> may hide themselves <S%H5641><s%>.
For he needeth not further <S%H7760><s%> to consider a man <S%H376><s%>, That he should go <S%H1980><s%> before God <S%H410><s%> in judgment <S%H4941><s%>.
He breaketh in pieces <S%H7489><s%> mighty men <S%H3524><s%> in ways past finding <S%H2714><s%> out <S%H5975><s%>, And setteth others in their stead <S%H312><s%>.
Therefore he taketh knowledge <S%H5234><s%> of their works <S%H4566><s%>; And he overturneth <S%H2015><s%> them in the night <S%H3915><s%>, so that they are destroyed <S%H1792><s%>.
He striketh <S%H5606><s%> them as <S%H8478><s%> wicked men <S%H7563><s%> In the open <S%H4725><s%> sight of others <S%H7200><s%>;
Because they turned aside <S%H5493><s%> from following him <S%H310><s%>, And would not have regard <S%H7919><s%> in any of his ways <S%H1870><s%>:
So that they caused the cry <S%H6818><s%> of the poor <S%H1800><s%> to come <S%H935><s%> unto him <S%H8085><s%>, And he heard the cry <S%H6818><s%> of the afflicted <S%H6041><s%>.

When he giveth quietness <S%H8252><s%>, who then can condemn <S%H7561><s%>? And when he hideth <S%H5641><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%>, who then can behold <S%H7789><s%> him <S%H1471><s%>? Alike whether it be done unto a nation, or unto a <S%H3162><s%> man <S%H120><s%>:
That the godless <S%H120><s%> man reign <S%H4427><s%> not <S%H4170><s%>, That there be none to ensnare the people <S%H5971><s%>.
For hath any said <S%H559><s%> unto God <S%H410><s%>, I have borne <S%H5375><s%> chastisement <S%H2254><s%>, I will not offend any more:
That which I see <S%H2372><s%> not <S%H1107><s%> teach <S%H3384><s%> thou me <S%H6466><s%>: If I have done iniquity <S%H5766><s%>, I will do it no more <S%H3254><s%>?
Shall his recompense <S%H7999><s%> be as thou wilt <S%H3588><s%>, that thou refusest it <S%H977><s%>? For thou must choose, and not I <S%H1696><s%>: Therefore speak what thou knowest <S%H3045><s%>.
Men <S%H582><s%> of understanding <S%H3824><s%> will say <S%H559><s%> unto me <S%H2450><s%>, Yea, every wise man <S%H1397><s%> that heareth me <S%H8085><s%>:
220 <S%H347><s%> speaketh <S%H1696><s%> without knowledge <S%H1847><s%>, And his words <S%H1697><s%> are without wisdom <S%H7919><s%>.
Would <S%H15><s%> that Job <S%H347><s%> were tried <S%H974><s%> unto the end <S%H5331><s%>, Because of his answering <S%H8666><s%> like wicked <S%H205><s%> men <S%H582><s%>.

For he addeth <S%H3254><s%> rebellion <S%H6588><s%> unto his sin <S%H2403><s%>; He clappeth <S%H5606><s%> his hands among us <S%H7235><s%>, And multiplieth his words <S%H561><s%> against God <S%H410><s%>.
